title: China, the US and the dangers of a war of words over national decline
description: An apparent chip advance by tech giant Huawei is being touted at home as a win over US sanctions and further evidence of waning American power.

title: US sanctions China-based drug network over fentanyl
description: The latest targets include 25 individuals and entities based in China, including Wang Shucheng and Du Changgen – members of a Chinese ‘syndicate’.

title: China’s consul general in New York pitches a positive economic outlook
description: ‘China is always above and beyond expectation,’ Huang Ping tells conference, which also hears that government policies can only go so far in the battle to restore consumer confidence.

title: Ukraine designates China’s biggest oil firms as ‘sponsors of war’ for Russian joint ventures
description: CNOOC Group, Sinopec Group and CNPC were added to the Ukrainian government’s register, which Kyiv claims is used by banks and insurance companies for risk assessments.

title: US demands release of Uygur scholar Rahile Dawut, given reported life sentence by China
description: State Department says Rahile Dawut’s imprisonment is part of Beijing’s efforts to ‘eradicate Uygur identity and culture and undermine academic freedom’.

title: Little hope of Chinese President Xi Jinping meeting US senators in Beijing, analysts say
description: A delegation from the US Senate will be the first congressional group to visit the Chinese capital in five years.

title: EU’s China ‘de-risking’ plan puts AI, semiconductors, quantum tech and biotech in cross hairs
description: Brussels reveals first four hi-tech categories that will be initial focus of economic security strategy to keep critical technologies out of Beijing’s hands.

title: Taiwan urges US to speed up weapons systems deliveries, boost defence supply chain
description: At a US military conference, Taiwan’s vice-minister for defence said military self-reliance is urgent in the face of persistent threats from the PLA.

title: China promises to make business, life in Shanghai easier for foreign companies
description: To bolster the confidence of business leaders, Shanghai has announced it will take steps to make work and life easier for companies and employees stationed there.

title: China needs ‘holistic approach’ to meet military modernisation goals
description: Leading PLA researcher says traditional equipment-oriented development no longer fit for purpose in fast-moving defence landscape.

title: China’s ‘extraordinary’ Chang’e 5 lunar mission wins award for its team
description: International astronautics academy honours ‘outstanding contributions to human lunar and deep space exploration’.

title: Giant pandas in zoos beyond natural latitude frustrated by being out of sync with their environment, find researchers
description: Inability to adapt to a zoo risks causing pandas physical and behavioural symptoms similar to human jet lag, metabolism issues or seasonal affective disorder.

title: Detention of China Evergrande founder Hui Ka-yan ‘a signal Beijing won’t let super-rich off the hook’
description: Hui ‘underestimated Xi Jinping’s determination’ to deflate China’s property bubble regardless of the impact on the private sector.

title: TikTok owner ByteDance’s valuation down 26 per cent to US$223.5 billion in stock buy-back from US employees, report says
description: ByteDance is looking to buy at least US$300 million worth of stock from current and former US employees at US$160 per share, according to The Information.

title: For Chinese chip-making, lack of advanced lithography systems becomes a focal point in wake of Huawei’s breakthrough
description: Chinese chip makers are constrained by the limits of their existing imported lithography equipment, and domestic machines lag far behind the cutting edge.

title: Shares of Evergrande and its property unit jump in Hong Kong as they resume trading after confirming chairman is under police control
description: The Shenzhen-based developer said it had been notified by relevant authorities in China that Hui was subject to mandatory measures, according to the exchange filing.

title: China flexes green thumb as it pursues agricultural self-reliance
description: With greater uncertainty in international trade and a host of issues leaving global food security in doubt, Beijing is investing even more time and resources into ensuring agricultural stability for the years to come.
